pakwâtikosiwin~pl. pakwâtikosiwina~ᐸᑳᐧᑎᑯᓯᐃᐧᐣ~NI~The act of being hated or detested; being hated greatly. (Plains). Alt. kakwâyakeyihtâkosowin (Northern).~(AE)

mâyipayiw~pl. mâyipayiwak or mâyipayiwa~ᒫᔨᐸᔨᐤ~VAI OR VII~S/he has a death or misfortune in the family; it does not run right, i.e.: a motor; s/he has bad or evil luck.~(AE)

O~~ᐅ~PRON~Possessive prefix, always placed before the noun to mean his or her.  Also used with third person in action words or verbs.  E.g. otinam - He takes it.~(MD)

ayahciyiniw~~ᐊᔭᐦᒋᔨᓂᐤ~NA~stranger  Or outsider, i.e.: Plains Cree use it to describe the Blackfoot peoples and Northern Cree use the word to indicate the Slavey speaking people~(EC)

ayahciyiniw~pl. ayahciyiniwak~ᐊᔭᐦᒋᔨᓂᐤ~NA~A stranger or outsider, i.e.: Plains Crees use it to describe the Blackfoot peoples; Northern Crees use the word to indicate the Slavey-speaking people.~(AE)

asepitam~~ᐊᓭᐱᑕᒼ~V PHRASE~He pulls it backwards.  This could also mean things, ideas or activities that are non-physical.  E.g. If somebody was late, the term would be - Easepitahk.~(MD)

pihtonew~~ᐱᐦᑐᓀᐤ~VTA~s/he peels it off by pulling, i.e.: the skin off a banana, s/he skins it, i.e.: usually used to refer to small fur bearing animals such as muskrat or beaver~(EC)

mac-âyisiw~~ᒪᐨ ᐋᔨᓯᐤ~VAI~s/he is bad, s/he is devilish; s/he is temperamental, cruel, wicked~(CW)

kotawe~~ᑯᑕᐁᐧ~VC~Start a fire.  Get a fire going (in the fireplace or the campfire).~(MD)

kwetipiw~~ᑫᐧᑎᐱᐤ~VP~He rolls over.  E.g. As a horse.  Or one in an accident with a car.~(MD)

misipisiw~pl. misipisiwak~ᒥᓯᐱᓯᐤ~NA~A cougar; lynx. (Northern). Alt. pakwaciminôs, misiminôs (Plains).~(AE)

okâminakasiy~pl. okâminakasiyak~ᐅᑳᒥᓇᑲᓯᕀ~NA~A Canada thistle; a thorn, i.e., from a rose bush. Var. kakasisiwat.~(AE)

nîswâpiskâw~pl. nîswâpiskâwa~ᓃᓵᐧᐱᐢᑳᐤ~VII~It consists of two pieces of metal, i.e.: a double barreled shotgun.~(AE)

pisiskêyihtamawêw~~ᐱᓯᐢᑫᔨᐦᑕᒪᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he cares for (it/him) for s.o.; s/he looks after (it/him) for s.o.~(CW)

kahki~~ᑲᐦᑭ~~A reply meaning you can or you may.  May also be a question.  Can you?~(MD)

pawâyihk~~ᐸᐋᐧᔨᕁ~~only partially visible or clarity is hampered by an obstacle intervening~(EC)

kakayesiyimew~~ᑲᑲᔦᓯᔨᒣᐤ~VTA~S/he suspects her/him to be a cheater; s/he deceives with her/his words.~(AE)

mâmawihisicikewin~pl. mâmawihisicikewina~ᒫᒪᐃᐧᐦᐃᓯᒋᑫᐃᐧᐣ~NI~The act of working together in a concerted effort, i.e.: a barn raising.~(AE)

pisiskêyihtam~~ᐱᓯᐢᑫᔨᐦᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he pays attention to s.t., s/he cares for s.t., s/he watches over s.t.~(CW)

mânokêw~~ᒫᓄᑫᐤ~VAI~s/he camps; s/he puts up a tent, s/he sets up a tipi; s/he makes a ceremonial lodge~(CW)

kâhcitinêw~~ᑳᐦᒋᑎᓀᐤ~VTA~s/he catches s.o., s/he procures s.o. (as money); s/he holds s.o., s/he seizes s.o.~(CW)

nisisê!~~ᓂᓯᓭ!~NDA~uncle!, cross-uncle!; mothers brother!, fathers sisters husband!; father-in-law!~(CW)

mitôn~~ᒥᑑᐣ~NI~lip  There is no common word for lip instead the word for a mouth is usually used~(EC)

piskihtisahwêw~~ᐱᐢᑭᐦᑎᓴᐦᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he drives s.o. away separately (as one cow from the herd); s/he drives s.o. apart~(CW)

kîminêw~~ᑮᒥᓀᐤ~VTA~s/he touches or feels s.o. sexually, s/he cops a feel; s/he touches s.o.s genitals~(CW)

miywêyimêw~~ᒥᔦᐧᔨᒣᐤ~VTA~s/he likes s.o., s/he thinks well of s.o.; s/he is pleased with s.o., s/he considers s.o. good~(CW)

opâstâmow~~ᐅᐹᐢᑖᒧᐤ~NA~slanderer; blasphemer; one who brings curses upon him/herself through improper speech or action~(CW)

apachihaw~~ᐊᐸᒋᐦᐊᐤ~V PHRASE~He is used as a help in doing something.  E.g. Animate nouns such as clocks, stoves and horses.~(MD)

asewaskwesin~~ᐊᓭᐊᐧᐢᑫᐧᓯᐣ~V PHRASE~He does not succeed at what he was going to do.  Literal meaning, a door is closed in his face.~(MD)

kapatêyâhokow~~ᑲᐸᑌᔮᐦᐅᑯᐤ~VAI~s/he drifts to shore, s/he is washed to shore by the current, s/he is blown to shore by the wind~(CW)

sehkepimipayîs~pl. sehkepimipayîswak~ᓭᐦᑫᐱᒥᐸᔩᐢ~NA~A vehicle that runs by itself, i.e.: a car. (Plains). Var. sehkes (Plains); Alt. wihcekitâpânâsk (Northern).~(AE)

sakowew~~ᓴᑯᐁᐧᐤ~VP~1. He whoops.  To utter a cry of excitement, joy or enthusiasm, especially during singing, or during a ceremony.~(MD)

nakacihtâwin~pl. nakacihtâwina~ᓇᑲᒋᐦᑖᐃᐧᐣ~NI~The act of being accustomed; acuity; mastery; being capable; capability. (Plains). Alt. kaskihcikewin (Northern).~(AE)

osâmisiw~~ᐅᓵᒥᓯᐤ~VAI~s/he has an over-bearing personality, s/he always has to be first or in the center of activity; s/he is excessive~(CW)

kîskwêw~~ᑮᐢᑫᐧᐤ~VAI~s/he is mentally disturbed, s/he is mad, s/he is crazy, s/he is insane, s/he is out of his/her mind; s/he is silly~(CW)

wihcekitâpânâsk~pl. wihcekitâpânâskwak~ᐃᐧᐦᒉᑭᑖᐹᓈᐢᐠ~NA~A stinking machine; a vehicle that runs by itself, i.e.: a car. (Northern). Alt. sehkepimipayîs, sehkes (Plains).~(AE)

kayasayis~~ᑲᔭᓴᔨᐢ~N~1.  An old specimen.  2.  An old fashioned object.  E.g. 1.  As in second-hand clothing or 2.  Outdated furniture.~(MD)

pîhtaw~~ᐲᐦᑕᐤ~IPC~besides, in the actual outcome; in the end, come to find out, as it appeared; exclamation expressing disappointment~(CW)

kwêskaham~~ᑫᐧᐢᑲᐦᐊᒼ~VTI~s/he changes s.t.s position; s/he turns s.t. with a fork (as in frying meat); s/he turns s.t. (using an instrument)~(CW)

kîtahtawê~~ᑮᑕᐦᑕᐁᐧ~IPC~at one time, at a certain point in time, sometime; at times, sometimes, once in a while; all at once, suddenly, soon~(CW)

wîhkasko-kisêyin~~ᐄᐧᐦᑲᐢᑯ ᑭᓭᔨᐣ~NA~Sweetgrass, Old-man-sweetgrass, Crow man who became one of the leading Plains Cree chiefs in the Battleford region~(CW)

nahastâw~~ᓇᐦᐊᐢᑖᐤ~VAIT~s/he puts s.t. away; s/he puts s.t. in its place, s/he places s.t. right; s/he stores, caches s.t.; s/he buries s.t.~(CW)

pônêyihtam~~ᐴᓀᔨᐦᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he ceases thinking of s.t., s/he thinks no more of s.t., s/he forgets s.t.; s/he gets over a worrying preoccupation~(CW)

nihtâ-~~ᓂᐦᑖ~IPV~able; good at, competent, practised, experienced, skillful at, expert at, known as one who does s.t. habitually; well~(CW)

nahtâ-~~ᓇᐦᑖ~IPV~able; good at, competent, practised, experienced, skillful at, expert at, known as one who does s.t. habitually; well~(CW)

ayiwâkeyimototawew~~ᐊᔨᐋᐧᑫᔨᒧᑐᑕᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~S/he is very arrogant towards her/him; s/he thinks herself/himself superior; s/he challenges her/him or it or others.~(AE)

ocihci-~~ᐅᒋᐦᒋ~IPV~back in time; far back; from before, earlier; having lived long enough for something; chance to, live to, live to see~(CW)

miyo-tôtawêw~~ᒥᔪ ᑑᑕᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he does s.o. good, s/he does s.o. a good turn, s/he affects s.o. beneficially, s/he does a charitable deed for s.o.~(CW)

pecastamiskâw~pl. pecastamiskâwak~ᐯᒐᐢᑕᒥᐢᑳᐤ~VAI~S/he is paddling towards us, i.e.: a person in a canoe or a muskrat in the water. (Northern). Alt. peciskâw (Plains).~(AE)

pîwêyimisow~~ᐲᐁᐧᔨᒥᓱᐤ~VAI~s/he despises him/herself; s/he thinks little of him/herself, s/he considers him/herself inferior, s/he feels inferior~(CW)

âhtaskêw~~ᐋᐦᑕᐢᑫᐤ~VAI~s/he moves from one reserve to another, s/he moves from one land to another, s/he changes his/her land; s/he emigrates~(CW)

âsowakâmêw~~ᐋᓱᐊᐧᑳᒣᐤ~VAI~s/he crosses a body of water, s/he fords a stream, s/he crosses a river at a shallow ford; s/he crosses the ice by foot~(CW)

opîkiskwestamâkew~~ᐅᐲᑭᐢᑫᐧᐢᑕᒫᑫᐤ~NA~Someone who speaks for others, i.e.: a spokesperson or lawyer; counsel; orator; one who speaks on the behalf of others.~(AE)

pîkokonêwêpayiw~~ᐲᑯᑯᓀᐁᐧᐸᔨᐤ~VAI~s/he has cracks in his/her mouth, s/he has his/her mouth break out in blisters (e.g. from thrush); s/he has canker sores~(CW)

masinahikêw~~ᒪᓯᓇᐦᐃᑫᐤ~VAI~s/he writes, s/he writes things, s/he is literate; s/he owes; s/he takes employment; s/he gives credit; s/he gets credit~(CW)

pimipayihtâw~~ᐱᒥᐸᔨᐦᑖᐤ~VAIT~s/he runs s.t., s/he operates s.t., (e.g. machine, program); s/he keeps s.t. up, s/he exercises s.t.; s/he conducts s.t.~(CW)

itâspinêmêw~~ᐃᑖᐢᐱᓀᒣᐤ~VTA~s/he calls s.o. such in anger, s/he angrily calls s.o. such a name, s/he thus scolds s.o. in anger, s/he reproves s.o. so~(CW)

kakâyawisiw~pl. kakâyawisiwak~ᑲᑳᔭᐃᐧᓯᐤ~NA~An industrious worker  Var. okâyawisiw; (vai) s/he consistently works hard. (Plains). Alt. ayiwâkispihtisiw (Northern).~(AE)

pîkiskwêwin~~ᐲᑭᐢᑫᐧᐃᐧᐣ~NI~word, expression, phrase; what is being said, speech, talk, conversation; lecture; language; voice; syllable of syllabary~(CW)

takwaham~~ᑕᑲᐧᐦᐊᒼ~VTI~s/he crushes s.t. (by hand); s/he adds s.t. by tool; s/he pounds or presses s.t. with a heavy weight; s/he crushes berries~(CW)

pahkitewipimiy~pl. pahkitewipimiya~ᐸᐦᑭᑌᐃᐧᐱᒥᕀ~NI~A chemical used to ignite material; combustable chemicals such as gas or propane. (Plains). Alt. pahkwehkasikan (Northern).~(AE)

pahkwehkasikan~pl. pahkwehkasikana~ᐸᐦᑫᐧᐦᑲᓯᑲᐣ~NI~A chemical used to ignite material; combustable chemicals such as gas or propane. (Northern). Alt. pahkitewipimiy (Plains).~(AE)

pa~~ᐸ~REDUPLICATGIVE PREFIX~Meaning over and over again.  May also change the meaning of word as an insert, as in nitapin - nipatapin.  I miss my seat.~(MD)

amâhamawew~pl. amâhamawewak~ᐊᒫᐦᐊᒪᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~S/he scares it away so that it will not come close to others; s/he has disturbed the place so that nothing will come to it.~(AE)

tipêyimêw~~ᑎᐯᔨᒣᐤ~VTA~s/he owns s.o., s/he possesses s.o.; s/he is in charge of s.o., s/he controls s.o.; s/he rules over s.o., s/he governs s.o.~(CW)

peciskâw~pl. peciskâwak~ᐯᒋᐢᑳᐤ~VAI~S/he is paddling towards us, i.e.: a person in a canoe or a muskrat in the water. (Plains). Alt. pecastamiskâw (Northern).~(AE)

kanawêyihtamohêw~~ᑲᓇᐁᐧᔨᐦᑕᒧᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he asks s.o. to look after (it/him); s/he leaves (it/him) in s.o.s care, s/he leaves (it/him) to be looked after by s.o.~(CW)

mahkiskam~~ᒪᐦᑭᐢᑲᒼ~VTI~s/he makes big footprints or tracks, s/he makes a big footprint (on s.t.); s/he stretches s.t. (e.g. clothing) through wear~(CW)

kotawiw~~ᑯᑕᐃᐧᐤ~VP~He burrows himself under and disappears.  As a mole.  Also said about the sun or moon when it disappears behind the clouds.~(MD)

mâyi-tôtawêw~~ᒫᔨ ᑑᑕᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he does a bad thing to s.o., s/he does evil to s.o., s/he makes s.o. sick, s/he puts a curse on s.o., s/he does s.o. wrong~(CW)

môskomêw~~ᒨᐢᑯᒣᐤ~VTA~s/he moves s.o. to tears by weeping or speaking; s/he makes s.o. cry, s/he makes s.o. weepy, s/he makes s.o. become emotional~(CW)

cikêmâ~~ᒋᑫᒫ~IPC~of course, certainly, naturally, obviously, as might be expected, as a natural result, certain consequence; evidently; because~(CW)

wanwêhkawêw~~ᐊᐧᓀᐧᐦᑲᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he utters (it) wrongly to s.o.; s/he confuses s.o. through incorrect speech, s/he leaves s.o. baffled by speech or in speech~(CW)

kâhcitinam~~ᑳᐦᒋᑎᓇᒼ~VTI~s/he catches s.t., s/he procures s.t.; s/he holds s.t., s/he seizes s.t.; s/he reaches s.t., s/he gets s.t. with effort by hand~(CW)

nihtâwêyihtam~~ᓂᐦᑖᐁᐧᔨᐦᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he is resourceful; s/he has knowledge for doing; s/he is clever (about s.t.), s/he is able to solve problems; s/he is content~(CW)

piminawatew~pl. piminawatewak~ᐱᒥᓇᐊᐧᑌᐤ~VTA~S/he makes someone cook for her/him; s/he makes her/him something to eat. (Plains). Alt. kîstepohew or micisohkawew (Northern).~(AE)

sisopâtam~~ᓯᓱᐹᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he licks s.t.; s/he spits s.t. spattering (e.g. in traditional healing practice of chewing herbs which are blown on a patient)~(CW)

takonêw~~ᑕᑯᓀᐤ~VTA~s/he adds on to s.o., s/he adds more to s.o., s/he adds (it/him) to s.o.; s/he includes s.o.; s/he holds s.o. close to something~(CW)

peyakopiponiwesis~~ᐯᔭᑯᐱᐳᓂᐁᐧᓯᐢ~N~A yearling or a colt.  Could be a bird.  May also be called a piponaskos.  In speaking, the word sounds like peyakoponiwesis.~(MD)

itâcimow~~ᐃᑖᒋᒧᐤ~VAI~s/he tells thus, s/he narrates thus; s/he tells such a story, s/he tells news thus; s/he crawls there, s/he crawls to such a point~(CW)

maskominânâhtik~pl. maskominânâhtikwak~ᒪᐢᑯᒥᓈᓈᐦᑎᐠ~NA~A mountain ash tree. Also used by Northern Cree for Red Willow from which kinnikinik is made. (Plains). Alt. waciwahtik (Northern).~(AE)

atotêw~~ᐊᑐᑌᐤ~VTA~s/he makes a request of s.o., s/he asks s.o. to do something; s/he engages s.o. for something, s/he employs s.o.; s/he commands s.o.~(CW)

onîkâtew~pl. onîkâtewak~ᐅᓃᑳᑌᐤ~VTA~S/he packs or carries her/him or it on his/her shoulders; (na) the name for the Carrier people. (Northern). Alt. onayahcikew (Plains).~(AE)

kitahamawêw~~ᑭᑕᐦᐊᒪᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he warns s.o. against (it/him), s/he advises s.o. against (it/him); s/he forbids (it to) s.o.; s/he disciplines s.o. (i.e. children)~(CW)

kihceyihtâkosowin~pl. kihceyihtâkosowina~ᑭᐦᒉᔨᐦᑖᑯᓱᐃᐧᐣ~NI~The act of showing reverence; reverential; esteem, great consideration; respected; revered. (Plains). Alt. kihceyimikosowin (Northern).~(AE)

mâmitonêyihtam~~ᒫᒥᑐᓀᔨᐦᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he thinks about s.t., s/he ponders s.t., s/he ponders over s.t., s/he considers s.t., s/he wonders about s.t.; s/he worries about s.t.~(CW)

mâyitôtamowin~pl. mâyitôtamowina~ᒫᔨᑑᑕᒧᐃᐧᐣ~NI~The act of doing things wrong; improper conduct or misconduct; villainy; the act of being wrong. (Plains). Alt. naspâtisiwin (Northern).~(AE)

miywêyihtam~~ᒥᔦᐧᔨᐦᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he is glad, s/he is happy, s/he is pleased; s/he is glad about s.t.; s/he likes s.t., s/he thinks well of s.t., s/he considers s.t. good~(CW)

askowiskawêw~~ᐊᐢᑯᐃᐧᐢᑲᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he comes next after s.o. (in age); s/he is next to s.o., s/he follows s.o. (in birth, age, height, or position); s/he is taller than s.o.~(CW)

pamihtâw~~ᐸᒥᐦᑖᐤ~VAIT~s/he takes care of s.t., s/he looks after s.t., s/he attends to s.t., s/he tends s.t.; s/he drives s.t.; s/he manages s.t. (e.g. a business)~(CW)

sehkes~pl. sehkeswak~ᓭᐦᑫᐢ~NA~A stinking vehicle; a vehicle that runs by itself, i.e.: a car. (Plains). Var. sehkepimipayîs (Plains); Alt. wihcekitâpânâsk (Northern).~(AE)

wîhêw~~ᐄᐧᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he names s.o., s/he gives a name to s.o.; s/he calls s.o. so, s/he mentions s.o. by name; s/he relies on s.o., s/he tells (it/him) from s.o.~(CW)

chipachaw~~ᒋᐸᒐᐤ~VP~Anything that is pointed (or conical) in shape.  E.g.  A steep hill.  From the observers point of view, it means it is in an upright position.~(MD)

wanêyihtam~~ᐊᐧᓀᔨᐦᑕᒼ~VTI~s/he forgets s.t., s/he misses s.t., s/he is unsure of s.t., s/he hass his/her own mind blurred, s/he is confused; s/he goes wrong; s/he faints~(CW)

sôskwâc~~ᓲᐢᑳᐧᐨ~IPC~just, regardless, no matter what the consequences; truly, surely; directly, immediately, straight away; simply, without further ado, without delay;~(CW)

kiskinowâpahtihêw~~ᑭᐢᑭᓄᐋᐧᐸᐦᑎᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he teaches s.o. by example, s/he teaches s.o. by showing the way; s/he sets an example for s.o. by his/her own conduct; s/he shows s.o. by example~(CW)

kakêskimâwasow~~ᑲᑫᐢᑭᒫᐊᐧᓱᐤ~VAI~s/he lectures (his/her own) children, s/he counsels (his/her own) children; s/he cautions (his/her own) children; s/he advises (his/her own) children~(CW)

ayahciyiniw~~ᐊᔭᐦᒋᔨᓂᐤ~NA~stranger  Or outsider, i.e.: Plains Cree use it to describe the Blackfoot peoples and Northern Cree use the word to indicate the Slavey speaking people~(EC)

isîhcikêw~~ᐃᓰᐦᒋᑫᐤ~VAI~s/he does things thus, s/he makes things thus, s/he settles things thus, s/he proceeds thus; s/he performs a ceremony thus, s/he performs such a ritual~(CW)

ayahciyiniw~pl. ayahciyiniwak~ᐊᔭᐦᒋᔨᓂᐤ~NA~A stranger or outsider, i.e.: Plains Crees use it to describe the Blackfoot peoples; Northern Crees use the word to indicate the Slavey-speaking people.~(AE)

asepitam~~ᐊᓭᐱᑕᒼ~V PHRASE~He pulls it backwards.  This could also mean things, ideas or activities that are non-physical.  E.g. If somebody was late, the term would be - Easepitahk.~(MD)

wîcêwêw~~ᐄᐧᒉᐁᐧᐤ~VTA~s/he gets along with s.o.; s/he comes along with s.o., s/he accompanies s.o., s/he joins s.o.; s/he has s.o. along, s/he is with s.o., s/he lives with s.o.~(CW)

ayahchiyiniw~~ᐊᔭᐦᒋᔨᓂᐤ~N~A member of another Indian tribe.  Used by the Plains Cree for a member of the Blackfoot Confederacy; or any outcast or ostracized member of an Indian band.~(MD)

sisopâtêw~~ᓯᓱᐹᑌᐤ~VTA~s/he spreads (it/him) on s.o.; s/he spits (it/him) onto s.o. spattering (e.g. in traditional healing practice of chewing herbs which are blown on a patient)~(CW)

aspataha~~ᐊᐢᐸᑕᐦᐊ~V COMMAND~Hit an object while it is guarded or being covered with something.  E.g. Wild meat has to be covered with a thick cloth or canvas, while it is being crushed.~(MD)

niciwâmiskwêm~~ᓂᒋᐋᐧᒥᐢᑫᐧᒼ~NDA~my female parallel cousin; wife of my male cross-cousin; my fathers brothers daughter, my mothers sisters daughter; my fellow tribeswoman; my sister-in-law~(CW)

pimâcihisow~~ᐱᒫᒋᐦᐃᓱᐤ~VAI~s/he makes a living for him/herself, s/he is able to support him/herself; s/he restores him/herself to life, s/he cures him/herself; s/he makes him/herself live~(CW)

onayahcikew~pl. onayahcikewak~ᐅᓇᔭᐦᒋᑫᐤ~NA~A carrier; one who carries packs; one who packs or carries her/him or it on his/her shoulders; the name for the Carrier people. (Plains). Alt. onîkâtew (Northern).~(AE)

tipêyimisow~~ᑎᐯᔨᒥᓱᐤ~VAI~s/he controls him/herself, s/he governs him/herself, s/he owns him/herself; s/he is in charge of him/herself, s/he is on his/her own, s/he is free, s/he is independent~(CW)

sawêyimêw~~ᓴᐁᐧᔨᒣᐤ~VTA~s/he cherishes s.o., s/he loves s.o., s/he takes care of s.o., s/he looks out for s.o.; s/he is generous to s.o.; s/he blesses s.o.; s/he gives s.o. the last sacrament~(CW)

nakacihêw~~ᓇᑲᒋᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he is familiar with s.o.s character, s/he knows s.o. well, s/he is able to get along with s.o. through proper observation of his/her character; s/he observes s.o. well~(CW)

kaskihêw~~ᑲᐢᑭᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he is able to deal with s.o.; s/he manages, s/he controls s.o., s/he convinces s.o., s/he makes s.o. do something; s/he is able to seduce s.o.; s/he earns s.o. (i.e. money)~(CW)

anâskêw~~ᐊᓈᐢᑫᐤ~VAI~s/he puts flooring down, s/he lays carpet, s/he puts down linoleum; s/he lays mats, s/he spreads a blanket; s/he uses s.t. as a covering; s/he lays s.t. on the ground or floor~(CW)

manâcihêw~~ᒪᓈᒋᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he is careful with s.o., s/he is protective about s.o., s/he avoids hurting s.o.; s/he spares s.o.; s/he respects s.o., s/he treats s.o. with respect; s/he uses s.o. carefully~(CW)

pamihêw~~ᐸᒥᐦᐁᐤ~VTA~s/he takes care of s.o., s/he looks after s.o., s/he helps s.o., s/he gives aid to s.o., s/he attends to s.o., s/he tends s.o., s/he serves s.o.; s/he drives s.o. (e.g. horse, car)~(CW)

âyimisiw~~ᐋᔨᒥᓯᐤ~VAI~s/he has a difficult time; s/he is difficult, s/he is troublesome; s/he is demanding, s/he is constantly in need of attention from his/her parents; s/he is of difficult disposition~(CW)

niyakâtôtamân~~ᓂᔭᑳᑑᑕᒫᐣ~IPC~There is no legal equivalent in Cree for the terms of  guilty or not guilty. For a plea of  guilty, a speaker would use the above expression to indicate  I am responsible for doing it.~(AE)

taki~~ᑕᑭ~VP~You should.  Used in auxiliary function; to express what is probable or expected; to express a request in a polite manner or to soften a direct statement; or to express condition or obligation.~(MD)

namoya nîya kâtôtamân~~ᓇᒧᔭ\xa0 ᓃᔭ\xa0 ᑳᑑᑕᒫᐣ~IPC~There is no legal equivalent in Cree for the terms of  not guilty or  guilty. For a plea of  not guilty, a speaker would use the above expression to indicate  I am not responsible or I did not do it.~(AE)

sekonew~~ᓭᑯᓀᐤ~VTI~S/he empties or cleans out the buckets; s/he slips her/him underneath to hide her/him; s/he slips it underneath to hide it; s/he slips things underneath to hide them; they slip her/him underneath to hide her/him.~(AE)

nîtim~pl. nîtimak~ᓃᑎᒼ~NA~My sister-in-law; women say â€“my sisterâ€™s husband î; men say â€“my brotherâ€™s wife î; my first cousin, Var. nistes, nimis, niciwam; second cousin, what a man calls a woman or what a woman calls a man, Var. nîcimos.~(AE)

ahchi~~ᐊᐦᒋ~IPC~1.  In spite of.  2.  Means theres a change in thought or action, because something was done on purpose; E.g. Ahchanaâ€¦(A subtle message to mean â€¦or you will be sorry).  3.  Used as a singular word to complete some event that is going to happen.~(MD)
